text:
This is a 69 yoM CAD s/p CABG,DM, and decreased LVEF 20-30% on coumadin
   who experienced right flank pain was driving his car. came to [**Hospital1 19**] ED,
   found to have spontaneous RP/L kidney bleed. Admitted to the floor for
   further w/u. got 2 units FFP. while on the floor pt desatting,
   decreased UOP despite 60mg lasix. projectile vomited CG emesis, placed
   on 100% NRB and tx to the MICU. Here he is doing better, 96-97% on 6L
   n/c.
   Diabetes Mellitus (DM), Type I
   Assessment:
   FS 250-300.
   Action:
   Insulin as per SS.Tightened the SS
   Response:
   Cont to monitor FS.
   Plan:
   Cont to monitor.Administer full dose of glargine in am.
   Retroperitoneal bleed (RP bleed), spontaneous
   Assessment:
   [**Last Name (un) 61**] firm/tender/distended.BS pos/hypoactive.Pt c/o pain to RLQ.Hct was
   21.0 post 1 unit PRBC.
   Action:
   Received 2 units of PRBC.Dilaudid for pain.
   Response:
   Good pain control after dilaudid.Hct this am 26.2
   Plan:
   CT in am to re-evaluate for bleed.
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Cr 5.3 on pm labs.UO low
   Action:
   Received 120mg lasix x1 overnight.
   Response:
   Cr 5.8 this am.Put out 210 after the frusemide.
   Plan:
   Renal involved.Accepting Cr upto 6.0 as per renal.
   Atrial fibrillation (Afib)
   Assessment:
   Pt is v paced with underlying Afib.This am @ 01:30 pt started to have
   frequent pvc
s/runs of vtach occasionally(rhythm with changing axis).BP
   stable all through out.
   Action:
   ECG taken,reviewed by team.Not sure whats going on.Cards
   consulted.Think that he must be having runs of Afib wth some of it
   being paced.Pt is started on 25 of metoprolol [**Hospital1 7**].
   Response:
   Still having runs of vtach.Lytes stable
   Plan:
   Cont to monitor.
